attributes.comment:
Please consider the already skyrocketing costs of both national and international
adoption before subjecting parents to more costs through an increase in fees for
filing paperwork. As an adoptive parent we spent $35K on our adoption and every
penny spent was worth it. However, it seems that adotpion costs go up daily and
and increase in USCIS fees may be enough to deter even more families from
adopting. As taxpayers, adoptive parents, are putting money into the system and
should not be subjected to more out of pocket expenses for adoptions. I do not
agree with many ways the federal government handles the finances of this
country. It seems that our government has taken to the American way of being in
debt up to our eyeballs. I do not think that increases to filing the I 600A is an
appropriate way to cut costs and pass that onto usually very upstanding American
citizens.

Thank you for your time and consideration on this subject matter.

Summer Henson
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Summer Henson
